description_txt: stated on November 7, 2011 in a memo on behalf of the New Jersey Democratic State Committee:
quote_txt: "Governor Christie also remains the only Governor since World War II, among both Democrats and Republicans, who failed to have his party win control of at least one legislative body over the course of his term."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Ilana Shafran Mandel’s stake in Forest City Enterprises "constitutes significantly less than 1 percent" of the company’s shares and any implication of a conflict of interest "is legally incorrect."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a Republican presidential debate in Michigan:
quote_txt: "The unemployment rate among (the) non-college-educated is well into the double digits in America. It's 4 percent or 5 percent for people who have college degrees."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a written opening statement for a debate:
quote_txt: Under President Barack Obama, "more Americans are in poverty ... than at any time since the Census Bureau began keeping records on it over 50 years ago."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in tweet and blogs:
quote_txt: Obama creates new tax on Christmas trees, fees get passed on to consumers.

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2011 in an opinion column.:
quote_txt: "The Confederate battle flag never flew over Texas, but... you might soon see it on our license plates."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: In Georgia, "hard-earned lottery dollars are doled out to the scion[s] of wealthy families."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in a speech in the House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "The problem with invasive species today in the Great Lakes isn’t ballast water."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2011 in speech at Florida Democratic Party 2011 Convention:
quote_txt: "Today 46 percent of all Floridians owe more on their home than it is worth."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2011 in a conference call with reporters:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "is committed to overturning Roe vs. Wade, and he supports such amendments that define a life as beginning at the moment of conception."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2011 in a speech on energy policy at University of New Hampshire:
quote_txt: The United States sends "$300 billion -- half our trade deficit -- overseas for oil to unstable and unfriendly regimes."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2011 in a congressional hearing:
quote_txt: "A couple retiring today will pay about $119,000 in lifetime Medicare taxes and receive about $357,000 in lifetime Medicare benefits. ... about 3 bucks in benefits for every dollar in taxes."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2011 in a newspaper column:
quote_txt: "If [Atlanta Mayor Kasim Reed] wants to be like Bull Connor, then so be it."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2011 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: The EPA "wants to hire 230,000 new government regulators that will cost the taxpayer $21 billion."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2011 in a speech in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "We spend half a trillion dollars a year in tax preparation."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2011 in website article, emails, direct mail:
quote_txt: "People are five to seven times more likely to be murdered in workplaces that allow firearms than in those that prohibit it."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2011 in a video posted on YouTube:
quote_txt: "You’re paying for...(state Sen. Diane Allen’s) health care, and she took yours away."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "The average homeowner spends more than $2,000 each year on energy costs – more than on either real estate taxes or homeowners insurance."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2011 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Says that under his tax plan, "no matter where you are in the stratosphere, you're going to be getting a tax cut."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2011 in a speech in the House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "Every day in the United States, we are losing 15 factories."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2011 in a presentation:
quote_txt: Wisconsin ranks 48th out of all 50 states in venture capital investment.

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Says "over the last 48 years, every governor at the midterm of his first term or her first term has lost seats in the Legislature, with the exception of Jim McGreevey in 2003."

description_txt: stated on October 27, 2011 in testimony at a General Assembly pension hearing:
quote_txt: Rhode Island Treasurer Gina Raimondo "raised the mortality rate from 65 to 87" and "used a 1994 annuity chart" to create the pension crisis.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 6, 2011

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2011 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney has flip-flopped on abortion rights.

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2011 in a political advertisement:
quote_txt: "Corrupt political bosses. Money laundering. Fraud. It’s just another day at the office for Vin Gopal."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in an op-ed in USA Today:
quote_txt: Repealing the health care law "would save $95 billion in 2016."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says if elected, he would be the first Mayor who lives east of 82nd.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2011 in a Senate committee meeting:
quote_txt: Proof of citizenship isn't necessary before you register to vote in Florida.

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: A state bill would end a longstanding requirement that local governments repair highways and sidewalks -- and block injured citizens from suing over neglected maintenance.

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2011 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: Says "the City of Portland alone has 84 public relation representatives on payroll which cost taxpayers over $6.2 million (a year)."
